holidays.name: Constitution Day (USA)
holidays.description: Celebrate the signing of the U.S. Constitution on September 17, 1787. It's a day to appreciate the supreme law of the land and the beginnings of American democracy!
holidays.origin: Established to commemorate the signing of the U.S. Constitution at the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia.
holidays.funFact: September 17 is sometimes called "Citizenship Day" as well, honoring all who have become U.S. citizens.

holidays.name: National Apple Dumpling Day
holidays.description: A tasty day dedicated to the sweet, cinnamon-spiced apple dumpling. Perfect excuse to bake this cozy treat!
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday likely celebrated by apple lovers and dessert fans.
holidays.funFact: Apple dumplings have been around since colonial America, when apples were one of the most accessible fruits for baking.

holidays.name: International Coastal Cleanup Day
holidays.description: A global day encouraging volunteers to clean up litter and debris on beaches and waterways, protecting marine life and promoting environmental health.
holidays.origin: Started by The Ocean Conservancy in 1986 to combat ocean pollution.
holidays.funFact: Over 13 million volunteers participate worldwide each year, helping to remove millions of pounds of trash from coastlines.

holidays.name: Tell a Fairy Tale Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day to share your favorite fairy tales, whether classic or original, inspiring magic and imagination.
holidays.origin: An unofficial fun day for storytelling enthusiasts and kids alike.
holidays.funFact: Fairy tales like Cinderella and Snow White often carry hidden lessons and morals beyond just entertaining stories.
